data.title: Actor Neil Patrick Harris and partner David Burtka wed in Italy
data.meta_description: Television and stage actor Neil Patrick Harris has married his partner of 10 years, chef David Burtka, in a private ceremony in Italy over the weekend.
data.text:
Television and stage actor Neil Patrick Harris has married his partner of 10 years, chef David Burtka, in a private ceremony in Italy over the weekend.

The pair confirmed the wedding had taken by place via social media.

"We put the 'n' and 'd' in husband," 41-year-old Harris said via his Twitter account.

The pair were formally engaged when New York legalised gay marriage in 2011, however Harris has said they proposed to one another at least five years before that.

According to reports the wedding was small, attended only by family and close friends.

The pair wore matching custom Tom Ford tuxedos.

The nuptials were officiated by the pair's friend, Pam Fryman, who was a producer/director on How I Met Your Mother, the sitcom in which Harris most recently starred.

According to reports, Elton John performed at the reception.

"We happily confirm that Neil Patrick Harris and David Burtka were married in Italy in an intimate ceremony surrounded by their close friends and family," a statement from Harris's management said.

The couple have two children, twins Gideon and Harper, who were born in 2010.

In 2012, Burtka said they were a very "co-dependent" couple.

"He's my lifeline, in an amazing way. Without him, I can't breathe," Burtka said. "The biggest thing is that he makes me laugh."
